meanings.definition: A spar extending forward from the bow of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The jibbooms on the ship help hold the sails in place.
meanings.sent2: The sailors climbed the jibbooms to adjust the rigging.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the jibbooms, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The jibbooms reached out like giant arms embracing the wind.
meanings.sent5: The jibbooms swayed gently with the rhythm of the waves.

meanings.definition: To extend or project forward like a jibboom.
meanings.sent1: The tree jibbooms towards the sky, reaching for the sun.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm jibbooms into every project he undertakes.
meanings.sent3: The cat jibbooms its paw out to catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter jibbooms through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The rocket jibbooms into space, leaving a trail of stardust behind.

meanings.definition: The spar or boom used to extend the foot of a crane.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers carefully attached the jibbooms to the crane.
meanings.sent2: The jibbooms of the crane reached out to lift heavy loads.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the jibbooms of the crane, looking for nuts.
meanings.sent4: The jibbooms of the crane stood tall against the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The jibbooms of the crane moved gracefully as it lifted building materials.
